title: New York Region News
summary:
New York To Fight Vaping, New York City Bans Nearly All Flavored E-Cigarettes Health officials have said that flavored e-cigarette products are popular among young people, who have shown an increase in vaping.
One Collector Might Know Tsadik Kaplan, who collects and sells prewar Judaica, will host an ‘Antiques Roadshow’-style appraisal and lecture in New York this month.
Politics NYC Mayor’s Aides Communicate in Encrypted Messages Aides to New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio have exchanged messages via Signal, an encrypted-messaging app.
Transit Brooklyn-Queens Expressway May Need Fix Sooner Than Expected New York City may need to overhaul a 1.5-mile stretch of the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway as early as 2021, according to members of a panel convened by Mayor Bill de Blasio.
Tri-State Area Judge Dismisses Challenge to New York Law Allowing Driver’s Licenses for Illegal Immigrants A New York state law allowing illegal immigrants to apply for driver’s licenses will take effect as planned after a federal judge rejected an upstate county clerk’s legal challenge.
paragraphs: New York To Fight Vaping, New York City Bans Nearly All Flavored E-Cigarettes Health officials have said that flavored e-cigarette products are popular among young people, who have shown an increase in vaping.

Culture How Much Is Your Old Menorah Worth? One Collector Might Know Tsadik Kaplan, who collects and sells prewar Judaica, will host an ‘Antiques Roadshow’-style appraisal and lecture in New York this month.

Politics NYC Mayor’s Aides Communicate in Encrypted Messages Aides to New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio have exchanged messages via Signal, an encrypted-messaging app. Good-government advocates warn such apps can be used to hide records and communications from the public.

Politics Rick Lazio Ponders GOP Suburban Strategy As former U.S. Rep. Rick Lazio considers a comeback bid for the congressional seat being vacated by Peter King, he has a plea to his fellow Republicans: Consider the moderates.

Crime Man Tied to Jersey City Shooters Faces Weapons Charge A New Jersey man who was linked to the shooters in last week’s Jersey City shooting rampage was expected to appear in federal court in Newark on Monday on a weapons possession charge, federal officials said.

Crime Teen Suspect in Slaying of Barnard College Student Is Released A 14-year-old boy taken into custody Friday on suspicion of involvement in the killing of a Barnard College student in Morningside Park was released; a 13-year-old facing charges appeared in court Friday.

New York Brooklyn Startups Face Speed Bumps Brooklyn’s tech startup scene is booming thanks to tax credits and incubators, but a Center for an Urban Future study finds transit issues, tech-talent shortages and limited real estate are holding them back.

Transit Brooklyn-Queens Expressway May Need Fix Sooner Than Expected New York City may need to overhaul a 1.5-mile stretch of the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway as early as 2021, according to members of a panel convened by Mayor Bill de Blasio.

Crime Two Teen Boys Arrested in Connection With Killing of Barnard Student A 13-year-old boy and a 14-year-old boy have been arrested in the slaying of a Barnard College student, according to officials with knowledge of the case.

Tri-State Area Judge Dismisses Challenge to New York Law Allowing Driver’s Licenses for Illegal Immigrants A New York state law allowing illegal immigrants to apply for driver’s licenses will take effect as planned after a federal judge rejected an upstate county clerk’s legal challenge.
